node.title: Families call for an end to 'perpetual quarantine' for international pilots and air crew in Queensland
node.alt: A woman with blonde hair and pink jumper and a man in masks with a black and white dog, also in a mask.
node.description: Under Queensland rules, international air crew must quarantine at home for 14 days – or until their next flight – after they land, putting them into multiple rotations of two weeks in quarantine.
node.content:
["Families of international pilots and air crew are calling for an end to the state of \"perpetual quarantine\" they are forced to endure as they fly in and out of Queensland.", "Under Queensland rules, international air crew must quarantine at home for 14 days \u2013 or until their next flight \u2013 after they land, putting them into multiple rotations of two weeks in quarantine.", "Dr Kate Gazzard, a GP and doctor of sports medicine, said her husband Tim, a pilot, had done about 18 weeks of quarantine over the past year, including more than five weeks since the start of last month.", "In one case, she said he flew to Samoa,\u00a0which has recorded just three cases during the pandemic and has been COVID-free since February last year. He did not get off the plane before flying home, but he still had to undertake two weeks in home quarantine.", "Dr Gazzard said the situation was \"ludicrous\", especially when COVID-positive cases and close contacts have to isolate for just seven days, and when air crew in NSW and Victoria are\u00a0simply required to isolate until they return\u00a0a negative test.", "\"They live in quarantine\u00a0when they get there, they live in quarantine when they get home,\" she said.", "Another complication\u00a0is that until recently,\u00a0as a GP and a designated worker,\u00a0Dr Gazzard could not go in to work when her husband was in home quarantine with her.\u00a0", "It has impacted their finances and taken a toll on their mental health, she said.", "The quarantine requirement for international travellers in Queensland is expected to lift once the state hits 90 per cent vaccination of its eligible population. As of Monday,\u00a087.8 per cent had\u00a0received two doses.\u00a0", "A spokesperson from Queensland Health has said there are still risks associated with overseas travellers, including air crew, and defended its approach of imposing tighter restrictions than those set nationally.", "One key concern, they said, was the quality of vaccinations, different variants circulating overseas and the contact tracing processes used in other countries.", "But Dr Gazzard pointed out variants could still get into the country via Sydney or Melbourne, spread in the community, and enter Queensland through domestic travel.", "", "
The couple normally like to spend time outdoors and keep active, but quarantine requirements have kept them indoors for weeks at a time.(Supplied)
", "\"It makes a complete mockery of every sacrifice we've made over the past two years,\" she said.", "Teri O'Toole, federal secretary at the Flight Attendants' Association of Australia, said \"the changing rules from state to state and day to day are creating a very uncertain workplace for cabin crew\".", "\"These rules should be nationwide and co-ordinated at a federal level,\" she said, calling on national cabinet to find a unified approach.", "Professor Catherine Bennett, chair of epidemiology at Deakin University, pointed out that quarantine and isolation were different.", "Isolation is to ensure someone with COVID-19 doesn't mingle with people while still infectious, whereas quarantine could be a longer period to ensure someone isn't incubating the virus and might test positive later, she said.\u00a0", "But she said with the extent of community transmission \u2014\u00a0Queensland recorded 18,000 new cases on Sunday and more than 9,500 on Monday \u2014\u00a0the states should be aligned on the issue of international arrivals and air crew quarantine.", "\"So in fact, by asking cabin crew to go into isolation, arguably, you're protecting them from coronavirus in the community, because they'd have more risk catching the virus in Queensland than they would on a plane,\" she said.", "Professor Bennett said it was an \"absolutely unreasonable ask\" of air crew, saying some had been in quarantine more or less since March 2020.", "She added that the testing should not be so onerous, and that people shouldn't have to line up for four hours to get a PCR\u00a0test.", "
International arrivals struggle to get tests
", "Beth Nichol, who has spent the past two years working on the COVID frontlines as a paramedic in London, arrived in Queensland on January 3.", "The Australian citizen hasn't been able to see her family in more than two and a half years, and said the 14-day quarantine rule for international arrivals was \"excessive\".", "", "
Beth Nichol arrived in Queensland from London and struggled to find a PCR test.(Supplied)
", "\"I think it is overkill, well and truly \u2026 seven days [is] fine, happy with that. But 14 days is just so excessive, especially with the rigorous testing we have to do to even leave [London],\" she said.", "She is now in home quarantine with her mother, and said it was a scramble to try and fulfil the testing requirements of a PCR test on day one and day 12.", "She said she \"spent all day driving from one test site to the next being turned away due to massive queues.", "\"There was car after car being turned away,\" she said.", "She said after being unable to get a PCR on day one, she tested negative on\u00a0a RAT she brought from London. She tried again on day two, only to be turned away from a testing site at 6am because the facility was overwhelmed before it even opened, she said.", "", "
International arrivals must quarantine in Queensland for 14 days, but not in NSW or Victoria.(AAP: Paul Miller)
", "\"Yes, I did come here knowing that I would have to quarantine \u2014\u00a0that's absolutely fine \u2014\u00a0but have processes or have systems in place that can manage it,\" she said.", "\"And I do understand I've come at a really awful time where it's kicking off \u2026 but I just think the government has made it so much more complicated than what it had to be.\"", "She has since received an email from Queensland Health notifying her that day one and day 12 tests are no longer required, and that instead she must do a PCR or RAT on day 10.", "Queensland Health has been approached for comment on testing availability for international arrivals.", "Ms Nichol expects to only have five days in Australia outside of quarantine, and was initially worried that the inaccessibility of testing might extend her quarantine period.", "\"I think it's frustrating when other states are different as well,\" she said.", "Dr Gazzard\u00a0hopes the rules will change before her husband arrives home from his next trip, when the clock will reset and his 14 days in quarantine will begin again.", "\"As a scientist, and as a medical doctor, having watched this pandemic unfold, to see the inconsistency of this particular policy \u2026 just flipped me over the edge,\" she said.", "\"I feel like the scientists from the movie Don't Look Up, when they're screaming at the politicians trying to say, 'Please listen to what you're doing and what you're saying and the policies you're implementing, because they just don't make any sense.'\""]
